authors: Health and Biomedical Informatics Centre, University of Melbourne, Melbourne, Victoria, Australia.

Health and Biomedical Informatics Centre, University of Melbourne, Melbourne, Victoria, Australia.
text: It is important for patients to have access to the health information they generate, for them to be actively engaged in their own healthcare. This is relevant to Kinect-based post-stroke rehabilitation systems; as such there is a need to review the literature based on person-generated management and utilisation. Previous systematic reviews on Kinect for stroke rehabilitation have not used this as part of their criteria. This systematic review fills that gap.
title: Use of Person-Generated Health Data in Kinect-Based Stroke Rehabilitation Systems: A Systematic Review.
journal: Studies in health technology and informatics
